00025 #ifndef EOS_EOSPRECISIONTIMER_H

00032 // sincerely, i have no time to port EOS in windows...
00033 // anyway, who cares? wincowz sucks...
00034 
00035 /*#if defined WIN32
00036    #ifndef WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
00037    #  define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
00038    #endif
00039    #include "windows.h"
00040    //Get around Windows hackery
00041    #ifdef max

00050    #include <sys/time.h>
00051 //#endif
00052 
00053 
00054 class EOSPrecisionTimer
00055    {
00056    protected:
00057       /*#if defined WIN32
00058       clock_t  zeroClock;
00059       DWORD    mStartTick;
00060       LONGLONG mLastTime;
00061       LARGE_INTEGER mStartTime;
00062       LARGE_INTEGER mFrequency;
00063       DWORD    mProcMask;
00064       DWORD    mSysMask;
00065       HANDLE   mThread;
00066       DWORD    mQueryCount;
00067       #elif defined LINUX*/
00068       struct timeval start;
00069       clock_t zeroClock;
00070       //#endif
00071 
00072    public:
00073       EOSPrecisionTimer() ;
00074       ~EOSPrecisionTimer() { }
00075 
00076       // Resets timer
00077       void reset();
00078 
00079       // Returns seconds since last reset
00080       float getSeconds();
00081 
00082       // Returns milliseconds since last reset
00083       unsigned long getMilliseconds();
00084 
00085       // Returns microseconds since last reset
00086       unsigned long getMicroseconds();
00087 
00088    };
